name: moodle-dl
description: Downloads course content fast from Moodle (e.g., lecture PDFs)

repo.name: Moodle-DL
repo.description: Moodle-DL downloads course content fast from Moodle (eg. lecture pdfs)

readme.summary: Well-structured README with clear purpose and installation steps, but lacks concrete usage examples and could benefit from more troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No concrete examples showing actual command output or file structure - users must infer how the tool works from descriptions rather than seeing real examples

injection_risks.description: The 'which' function from the shutil module is used to check if ffmpeg is available. This could potentially be exploited if an attacker can manipulate the PATH environment variable.
The 'os.path.isdir' function is used to check if a directory exists. This could potentially be exploited if an attacker can manipulate the file system.

critical_findings: No validation for user input in critical functions
Potential for error exposure due to lack of proper error handling
security.summary: The moodle-dl code has some security concerns, including potential injection risks and lack of input validation, but overall it appears to be well-structured and secure.

common_complaints: Authentication/SSO limitations (Microsoft SSO, mobile app restrictions)
Unhandled Moodle modules (custom modules like videolecture, pdfannotator)
File system constraints (file name too long errors)
Configuration wizard UX issues (confusing blacklist behavior)
sentiment.summary: Moodle-dl shows moderate community health with active issue reporting and some maintainer engagement, but responsiveness could be improved as several issues remain open with minimal feedback, particularly on authentication and custom module support.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are generally clear and helpful, showing patience with new contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being 27 days ago
33 open issues with no recent resolution activity
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no active issue triage
No merged PRs in past 6 months showing no active development
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests stalled release cycle
maintenance.summary: The moodle-dl package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite having unresolved issues.

governance.summary: The documentation lacks a succession plan and contributor ladder, which increases the risk of losing project continuity if primary maintainers leave.

project_metrics.description: Moodle-DL downloads course content fast from Moodle (eg. lecture pdfs)
